TopicTitle: You Know You're A Nerd When:

Articles.Content:
Just now, cubinator said:

A 3-digit LEGO kit? Like, as in, just one?

Well, only one of them's notable. I think I have a dozen or so.

Just now, 0111narwhalz said:

Well, only one of them's notable. I think I have a dozen or so.

Ah, that's better.

1 hour ago, cubinator said:

You know you're a nerd when you are eating cereal that has small semi-cubic chocolate pieces...

Oh, look! Probodobodyne QBE cereal!

Now 100% more Kerbal!

Just now, Aperture Science said:

Oh, look! Probodobodyne QBE cereal!

Now 100% more Kerbal!

Kerbal Krunch: Part of a balanced TWR!

You are a nerd when you decide to make a mathematical theory in your head

You know when you are a nerd when you can easily outsmart someone in a discussion about getting a rocket to mars. (I have done this cause I am the only rocket scientist and I am the smartest kid in my class [Fact])

You know you're a nerd when you...

...recognize the portrait of Konstantin Tsiolkovsky on sight...and set him as your background on all your devices.

...carry a scientific calculator in your pocket

...rate calculators based on the capacity of their cases to carry stacks of index cards...

...upon which you write tables of engine Isp, mathematical equations (and constants), and fuel tank mass ratios.

...calculate the amount of energy it would take to launch Hawaii (Big Island, not the whole archipelago) one kilometer deep, single stage, on a hydrogen-oxygen rocket. (By the way, it's about 20kT. Yes, that's the right unit.)

...have c stored permanently in your calculator.

...memorize the Vis-Viva equation. It's V2=µ(2/r-1/a).

...have all the parameters of the Rocket Equation set up as variables in a graphing calculator.

...get full credit, no questions asked, on math tests the instructor lost...

...and then get drafted to tutor the class a year up.

...break your wrist, but insist on continuing to out-nerd the competition on the KSP forums.

...have literally no presence on the major social networking websites, outside of YouTube comments.

...proofread your YouTube comments before posting...

...and find no mistakes.

 

Uhm. After typing all that out, I feel kinda self-conscious.

6 hours ago, cubinator said:

Kerbal Krunch: Part of a balanced TWR!

You know you are a nerd when you laughed at that.

You know you are a nerd when you try to derive equations yourself sometimes before looking them up...  And succeed sometimes!

You know you are a nerd when you are 18 and yet still consider being an astronaut a legitemate career posibility because you plan to becoming the ideal canidate no matter what the cost.

You know you are a nerd when your browser bookmarks include the astronomy picture of the day, the ISS live feed, and a site showing the hourly DSCOVR photos.

You know you're a nerd when you can strip a computer to the mobo, CPU and all, and put it back together in under 20 minutes.

You know you're a nerd you have more friends on Steam than you do in real life.

You know you're a nerd when you make a decision with a d20.
You know you're a nerd when 90% of the pictures in your screensaver are from SpaceEngine.

You know you're a nerd when you one day decide to put your own face on every single character in the Star Wars: The Force Awakens Trailer just so you can say you were in a Star Wars movie.....

Animation, lip syncing, color correction. The whole works using After Effects CC:

Awesome.........

Happy Flying

YargJay9991

(PS Yes... that is my face on Han Solo's head)

Edited February 19, 2016 by YargJay9991

8 hours ago, 0111narwhalz said:

Uhm. After typing all that out, I feel kinda self-conscious. 

Now why would you feel that way, Sheldon?
You know you are a nerd when you are trying to lucid dream largely because you want to fly every space ship real and otherwise.
You know you are a nerd when you know who the hat guy is.

You know when you are a nerd when you think people are lying when you stay facts

You know when you are a nerd when you find a Nuclear Reactor amazing and should be worshiped

You know when you are a nerd when  you find Documentary and Chill is amazing

You know when you are a nerd when you cant think of anything that is "Easy" at the top of youe head

You Know when you are a nerd when you fall in love with KSP

You know when you are a nerd when you have a NASA sweatshirt and wanted it REALLY bad

You know when you are a nerd when you LOVE stories

You know when you are a nerd when you go to KSC and just die of the Saturn V and the Space Shuttle

You know when you are a nerd when you take Honors Biology when you should be taking something harder
You know you're a nerd when you ask "Which one?" every time someone says "KSC."
You know you are a nerd when you refer to "The Cape" and "Vandy."

When your 6th grade teacher gives you a book on quantum physics with you 4.0 gradez.

 

happend to me...

You know you are a nerd when you have a custom bumper sticker on your car that says "My other car is a Delta-Glider".

If you don't know, the Delta-Glider is the most iconic ship in Orbiter space flight simulator, which I highly recommend to any KSP player especially considering that it's free.

13 hours ago, mikeman7918 said:

You know you are a nerd when you are trying to lucid dream largely because you want to fly every space ship real and otherwise.

You know you're a nerd when you comment about other forums posts you made
You know you are a nerd when you go to KSC specifically to see a SpaceX launch. At about 3 AM.

When you know that you could never be a nerd enough and will be each time even more in relative but less in absolute ; )

When you make long sentence

When you make short sentence, or wall of text, because after wall, sometime clarifying thing or messing them even more could both solve and or either complexify the thing yourself and the others, and as a matter of fact, the best to deal with anti matter is to find another matter that matter to matter about. This will contribute in the matter densification while at the same time reducing the space it use, wich is handy for storage prupose but but could be annoyin to extract and sort thing back. Of Course to highlight to wich point it bring you to a new horizon, you have to consider each event you cross daily, with no return option but to continue walking on that path as you're doing since the beggining.

When you don't like randomness

When you like randomness

When the age of the universe and it's uncertainty make you thought about your own ellipsis and certitude.

7 hours ago, WinkAllKerb'' said:

When you don't like randomness

When you like randomness

How exactly does this correlate with nerdiness?

when this:

Edited February 21, 2016 by WinkAllKerb''

You know you are a nerd when you are playing a sport in your Physical Education (PE) class and you start to wonder how your knowlage of physics could give you an edge, and when you realize that calculating the ball's trajectory is just simple classical mechanics that is basically common sense you think "what kind of witchcraft is this?".

This actually happened to me.  Quantum uncertainty, special relativity, the gravity gradient, Earth's curvature, tidal forces, and spacial expansion are all negligible.  Physics is not supposed to be this easy!!!
